text: The real question isn't job loss â€” it's whether institutions are ready to retrain at the speed AI deploys.
Healthcare sees augmentation. Finance sees replacement. Same technology, opposite narratives.
"Readiness" means something different in Dubai than in Detroit. Context is everything.
The host reframed: "What if the gap isn't between humans and AI, but between institutions and citizens?"
Group 1 consensus: workforce policy is 10 years behind the technology curve.
Education group argues AI literacy should be as foundational as reading and writing.
Surprising convergence: both regulators and builders agree transparency is non-negotiable.
Three themes emerged: institutional speed, trust architecture, and citizen agency.
